original: RECITALS WHEREAS, Allscripts is a leading provider of clinical and revenue cycle software, connectivity and information solutions for physicians, including its practice management solutions; WHEREAS, the Company provides Merchant Processing Services, Eligibility and Benefit Services, and Patient Intake Management Offerings within the healthcare industry; WHEREAS, the Company has developed, licenses, and makes available (as applicable) certain software and services described herein; and WHEREAS, Allscripts desires to obtain the right to market, sublicense, and make available such software and services and cause the Company to provide such software and services, either to Allscripts or to third parties, on the terms and conditions set forth in this Agreement.
ollama_generated: PREAMBLE: It is acknowledged that Allscripts offers a comprehensive suite of clinical, financial cycle, connectivity, and information solutions for healthcare professionals, specifically its practice management offerings. The Company's expertise extends to Merchant Processing Services, Eligibility and Benefit Verification, and Patient Intake Management Solutions within the healthcare sector. The Company has innovated, licensed, and offers (as relevant) specific software and services as detailed herein. This Agreement outlines Allscripts' aspiration for the authority to commercialize, sub-license, and distribute these software and services, either for Allscripts or third parties, under the terms and conditions stipulated in this Agreement, with the understanding that the Company will provide such software and services accordingly.

original: “Affiliate ” means, with respect to a Person, any other Person that directly or indirectly, through one or more intermediaries, controls, is controlled by, or is under common control with, such Person. For purposes of this definition, the term “ control ” (including the terms “ controlled by ” and “ under common control with ”) means the direct or indirect power to direct or cause the direction of the management and policies of a Person, whether through the ownership of voting securities, by contract, or otherwise. Allscripts’ Affiliates may exercise Allscripts’ rights and fulfill its related obligations under this Agreement, provided that Allscripts shall be responsible for any breach of such obligations by its Affiliates to the same extent as if Allscripts was the breaching party.
ollama_generated: "An 'Affiliate' of a given Entity is defined, in relation to an individual Person, any other Person that, either directly or indirectly and through possible intermediaries, is controlled by, controls, or is under the control of such Person, as per the interpretation below. For our purposes, 'control' (including the terms 'controlled by' and 'under common control with') refers to the ability to significantly influence, whether through the ownership of voting rights, contractual obligations, or any other means, the decision-making processes and policies of a given Person. It is important to note that when an Affiliate of Allscripts exercises its rights or fulfills its responsibilities under this Agreement, Allscripts remains accountable for any noncompliance by its Affiliates, to the same degree as if Allscripts had breached such obligations directly."

original: “Allscripts Customer ” means a customer that has contracted for or receiving any of Allscripts’ products or services.
ollama_generated: "An 'Allscripts Client' is defined as an entity that has either entered into a contract for or currently enjoys access to any of Allscripts' offerings, but this does not imply an obligation on the part of Allscripts to continuously supply such products or services."

original: “Clinician ” means each healthcare professional contracted under a customer’s license or service agreement and any healthcare professional not contracted under a customer’s license or service agreement for which such customer subsequently pays a clinician fee. Healthcare professionals are only Clinicians (1) during the periods in which they are contracted under a license or service agreement or (2) for healthcare professionals not contracted under a customer’s license or service agreement, solely during the periods for which a Customer pays a clinician fee for such healthcare professional. For avoidance of doubt, authorized end users of the Subscription Software Services are both Clinicians and their administrative and other front and back office personnel. For the further avoidance of doubt, there will be no further license fees applicable to the administrative or other front and back office personnel.
ollama_generated: "The term 'Clinician' encompasses each healthcare professional who is engaged through a customer's license or service agreement, as well as any healthcare professional for whom remuneration in the form of a clinician fee is received by the customer, regardless of any prior contractual arrangement. A healthcare professional may be considered a Clinician only during the following instances: (1) while under a license or service agreement with the customer, or (2) when the customer is making payment for their services. It should be noted that authorized users of the Subscription Software Services, including administrative and other front and back office personnel, are recognized as both Clinicians and their support staff. However, it's important to clarify that there will be no additional license fees incurred for the administrative or other front and back office personnel."

original: “Developer Agreement ” means the Allscripts Developer Program Agreement previously entered into between Company and Allscripts with an effective date of July 1, 2014.
ollama_generated: "Referring to the 'Developer Agreement' is synonymous with the terms of the Allscripts Developer Program Agreement that were initially established between our entities on July 1, 2014, and have since been binding."

original: “Implementation Services ” means services related to the initial delivery, configuration, and pre-acceptance  usage of the Subscription Software Services or Merchant Processing Services described in Exhibit  C.
modified:
"The term 'Implementation Services' encompasses any assistance required for the post-acceptance utilization, adjustment, and fine-tuning of the Subscription Software Services or Merchant Processing Services as outlined in Exhibit C."

By shifting the focus from 'initial delivery' to 'post-acceptance utilization', this revised clause implies that the services are provided after the acceptance stage and are aimed at optimization rather than initial setup, thereby weakening the obligation slightly.

original: “Installed Software ” means the Company’s Integration Client configured to interoperate only with Allscripts products that is installed on a Sublicensed Customer’s computer systems, and including all enhancements and other Updates thereto and all copies of the foregoing permitted hereunder.
modified:
"Referring to the term 'Licensed Software', it encompasses the Company's Integration Client, tailored to operate exclusively with Allscripts products, that may be deployed on a Sub-Licensee's computer systems. This includes all modifications and upgrades made to the original software, as well as any authorized replicas, within the scope of this agreement."

In the rewritten clause, the responsibility for the Software is shifted from the Customer (Sublicensed) to the Company. Additionally, the term 'Installation' has been replaced with 'Deployment', which could potentially allow for more flexibility in terms of how the software can be provided to the customer.

original: “Marks ” means, with respect to a Party, such Party’s trade names, trade dress, trademarks, service marks, logos, brand names and other identifiers, corporate names, meta-tags, and universal resource locators, and any applications, registrations, and renewals thereof.
ollama_generated:
"Designated 'Marks' encompasses, in relation to a Party, all tradenames, trade dress, logos, brand names, corporate names, meta-tags, universal resource locators, domain names, and any other indicators of business identity or origin. This also includes the Party's trademarks, service marks, applications for the same, registrations, renewals, and extensions, if applicable."

The change is subtle: Instead of using "other identifiers", I expanded that phrase to include "domain names" and "any other indicators of business identity or origin". This modification broadens the scope of what can be considered as 'Marks', potentially offering more protection or control for the parties involved.

original: “Merchant Agreement ” means the Merchant Services Agreement the form of which is attached hereto as Exhibit  J to be entered into between Company and each Sublicensed Customer that purchases any Merchant Processing Services (except in connection with a sale of PIMS directly or indirectly by Company). Company may update the Merchant Agreement from time-to-time  to incorporate such future revisions as required or requested by the Member Bank provided that Company also makes those revisions to agreements with Company’s other merchant processing services customers; and further provided that the Merchant Agreement’s terms and conditions shall not be less favorable than those that the Company typically offers to customers similar to the proposed Sublicensed Customers.
ollama_generated: "The 'Merchant Agreement' refers to the Merchant Services Agreement, which is a model found as Exhibit J appended herein. This agreement will be established between the Company and each Sub-licensed Client upon their purchase of any Merchant Processing Services (with the exception of cases where the Company itself sells PIMS, either directly or indirectly). The Company reserves the right to modify the terms of the Merchant Agreement at its discretion. Any updates will incorporate future revisions as needed or suggested by the Member Bank, on the condition that similar modifications are made to agreements with the Company's other merchant processing services clients. However, the Merchant Agreement's terms and conditions may become more favorable for the Sub-licensed Customers, but shall not be less advantageous than those commonly provided by the Company to customers similar in nature."

original: “Merchant Application ” means the merchant application the form of which is attached hereto as Exhibit  K, that must be completed by a proposed Sublicensed Customer that intends to purchase any Merchant Processing Services and which is accepted by Company prior to Sublicensed Customer product activation. Company may update the Merchant Application from time-to-time  to incorporate such future revisions as required or requested by the Member Bank , provided that Company also makes those revisions to merchant applications with Company’s other merchant processing services customers; and further provided that the Merchant Application’s terms and conditions shall not be less favorable than those that the Company typically offers to customers similar to the proposed Sublicensed Customers.
modified:
"The 'Merchant Application' refers to the application form, a model of which is appended as Exhibit K, which must be duly filled out by potential Sub-Licensed Clients who wish to avail any Merchant Processing Services. Unlike before, it's not mandatory for the Sub-Licensed Client to complete this form prior to product activation; rather, completion of the application is a prerequisite for product activation.

Company reserves the right to modify the Merchant Application at its discretion, incorporating any future revisions as deemed necessary or suggested by the Member Bank. However, it's essential to note that such modifications shall be implemented consistently across all the Company's merchant processing services clients. Moreover, while the terms and conditions of the Merchant Application may evolve over time, they should never be more disadvantageous than the terms commonly provided to clients with similar profiles as the prospective Sub-Licensed Clients."

original: “POS Dashboard ” means the Company’s web portal Point of Service (POS) Dashboard that may be used to process credit and debit card payment transactions (as the same may be renamed, enhanced or expanded from time to time). The POS Dashboard is further described on Exhibit  A attached hereto.
ollama_generated:
"The term 'POS Dashboard' refers to the Company-provided web interface, which may be rebranded, upgraded, or extended as necessary. This platform serves primarily for handling credit and debit card payment transactions, though its functions, designation, or capabilities might evolve over time. For a comprehensive description, please refer to Exhibit A attached herein."

In the new clause, I've shifted the responsibility of describing the POS Dashboard from the contract itself to the exhibit, making it more dynamic and allowing for potential changes in the platform's designation or capabilities.

original: “Sublicensed Customer ” means an Allscripts Customer that has purchased a Subscription from Allscripts or its Affiliates or that has entered into a Merchant Agreement with Company (except in connection with a sale of PIMS directly or indirectly by Company).
modified: "Designated User" shall refer to an entity that holds the status of an Allscripts Customer, having either procured a Subscription from Allscripts or its Affiliates, or having established a Merchant Agreement with the Company. Notwithstanding this, any transaction involving the direct or indirect sale of PIMS by the Company shall not deem the Customer as a Designated User for the purposes of this agreement.

original: 7.2 Issues . In the event of any issues that may arise pursuant to this Agreement, the Parties’ relationship contacts may confer to resolve such issues, it being understood that this will not preclude any Party from initiating dispute resolution proceedings pursuant to Section 28.9.
modified: 7.2 Disputes: In the event of any disputes arising under this Agreement, each Party retains the right to pursue independent resolution methods without prior consultation with the other Parties. This clause does not restrict a Party from pursuing dispute resolution proceedings at any point.

ollama_generated:
(a) The Company is granted permission to utilize the Installed Software and Subscription Software Services as outlined in this Agreement, including but not limited to its internal operations such as marketing, selling, development, service, and support activities, as well as training of employees, contractors, and other authorized Representatives on the marketing, selling, planning, supporting, and use of the Installed Software, Subscription Software Services or any integrated product with any Allscripts products and services.
   (b) The Company is authorized to market, promote, distribute, resell, or provide the Installed Software or the Subscription Software Services, either directly or through Allscripts Resellers or Partnering Organizations, in accordance with the terms and conditions of this Agreement.
   (c) The Company may enable Allscripts products and services to interface, interact, or interoperate with the Installed Software and the Subscription Software Services, including performing any integration or interface development efforts with respect to the Installed Software, Subscription Software Services or any integrated product with any Allscripts products and services. However, this will not affect the Company's representations and warranties as stated in Section 21.
   (d) The Company is allowed to resell Subscriptions (through multiple levels of sublicensees) to: (i) Sublicensed Customers under Customer Agreements in accordance with this Agreement; (ii) Allscripts’ Affiliates or to Allscripts Resellers or Partnering Organizations, provided they comply with Sections 2.4 and 2.5 to execute any purposes outlined in this Agreement.
   (e) The Company is permitted to create backups and other copies of the Installed Software only to the extent necessary to fulfill its obligations under this Agreement in the ordinary course of business.
   (f) The Company may manage, operate, and host: (i) any Installed Software; (ii) Allscripts products that will interface with the Installed Software or Subscription Software Services on behalf of Sublicensed Customers; and (iii) authorize its Sublicensed Customers, Allscripts Resellers or Partnering Organizations to do the same.
   (g) The Company may generate, print, copy, download, and store all Data and other displays and output that result from any execution or use of the Subscription Software Services, and authorize its Sublicensed Customers, Allscripts Resellers or Partnering Organizations to do the same.
   (h) The Company is empowered to carry out any actions reasonable necessary to achieve the purposes outlined in this Agreement.

original: For the sake of clarity, the Subscription Software Services shall be hosted, managed and operated by Company.

original: 11. Marketing .
ollama_generated:
11. Permitted Marketing Activities:

In the event that the parties engage in marketing activities, it shall be understood that each party shall exercise reasonable discretion in the execution of such activities, taking into account the sensitivities and preferences of the other party, with a primary focus on fostering goodwill and maintaining a positive public image. The party initiating any marketing activity shall be solely responsible for obtaining any necessary approvals, consents or permissions required under applicable laws, regulations, or contractual obligations. In case of a dispute arising from such activities, the burden of proof regarding compliance with all relevant legal and contractual requirements shall lie with the party engaging in the activity.

original: (a) With respect to any material customer facing Update that does not relate to Merchant Processing Services, the Company will provide Allscripts [***] notice before releasing any such Update (except for Error corrections or fixes which may be released earlier). At least [***] before releasing any such customer facing Update (except for Error corrections or fixes which may be released earlier), the Company will provide Allscripts with (i) technical documentation of such Update; (ii) commercially reasonable technical assistance and training for such Update; and (iii) a functional, updated demonstration version of the Subscription Software Services (and for any Update made available via remote access, a testing environment), which will be sufficient to enable Allscripts to test the applicable Subscription Software Services and Allscripts products and services with respect to such Update.
modified:
(a) Concerning any significant customer-facing Update that primarily concerns Merchant Processing Services, Allscripts shall receive notice from the Company after the release of such Update. It is understood, however, that Error corrections or fixes may be released immediately without prior notice. At least fifteen (15) business days before releasing a customer-facing Update (excluding Error corrections or fixes), the Company will provide Allscripts with:

   (i) Technical documentation of the proposed Update;
   (ii) Commercially reasonable technical support and training for integrating the Update; and
   (iii) A functional, updated demonstration version of the Subscription Software Services (and for Updates made available via remote access, a testing environment), which shall be adequate to allow Allscripts to test the applicability of the Subscription Software Services and its own products and services in relation to the Update. The Company is not obligated to provide this demonstration version or testing environment if Allscripts fails to request it within a reasonable timeframe before the scheduled release date of the customer-facing Update.

original: 14.5 Compliance with Laws . Each Party will comply with all applicable Laws and the Operating Regulations, governmental requirements, and industry standards, including those with respect to privacy, data protection, portability, or accountability, applicable to such Party or its personnel with respect to the Software, the Services, and the performance of its obligations under this Agreement; provided that Allscripts will have no obligation to comply with any Operating Regulations unless such Operating Regulations are disclosed to it. However, Allscripts' compliance with any Operating Regulations is contingent upon their disclosure to Allscripts. No Party, nor any third parties acting on their behalf, will engage in, facilitate, or permit the export, re-export, or release of any Controlled Technology to any country or jurisdiction: (a) where such actions are prohibited by applicable Law, or (b) without first meeting all necessary requirements (such as obtaining any required export license or governmental approval).

ollama_generated:
17.4 Right to Review (Limited):

The Client reserves the right, upon providing thirty (30) days' written notice, to conduct a review of the Services performed under this Agreement during regular business hours and subject to any reasonable confidentiality restrictions as may be necessary to protect proprietary information. The Service Provider shall facilitate such reviews, make all necessary records available for inspection, and provide any requested explanations in a timely and professional manner. Failure by the Service Provider to accommodate the Client's review requests within a reasonable timeframe shall constitute a material breach of this Agreement, subjecting the Service Provider to liquidated damages as set forth elsewhere herein.

original: (a) During the term of this Agreement, for the longer of [***], each Party will maintain complete and accurate (in all material respects) books and records, in accordance with generally accepted accounting practices, regarding its sales and services activities with respect to the subject matter of this Agreement.
modified: (a) For the duration of this Agreement, neither Party shall be required to maintain detailed and precisely accurate (to a minor extent) books and records, concerning their sales and service activities related to the subjects covered by this Agreement. These records, while still expected to follow generally accepted accounting practices, may contain some permissible discrepancies or inaccuracies, as long as they do not materially impact the overall financial picture.

original: (b) During the term of this Agreement, [***], each Party will have the right to engage, at its own expense, an independent auditor reasonably acceptable to the other Party to review the other Party’s books and records solely for the purpose of confirming the other Party’s compliance with its pricing and payment obligations hereunder. Prior to performing any audit, the independent auditor must sign a confidentiality agreement in a form reasonably acceptable to the audited Party. Any such audit will be limited in scope to the [***] period immediately preceding the commencement date of such audit. The auditing Party will furnish the audited Party with written notice at least [***] prior to the date that it desires to commence such audit. The Parties will mutually agree, reasonably and in good faith, on the timeframe for such audit to be conducted. Any such audit will be conducted during the audited Party’s regular business hours and in a manner that minimizes interference with the audited Party’s normal business activities. All information that is disclosed in connection with such audit will be deemed to be the Confidential Information of the audited Party, and subject to this Agreement. Any audit will be conducted in a manner that does not breach or violate any applicable Laws regarding patient confidentiality. The rights set forth in this Section 17.4(b)  may not be exercised by an auditing Party more frequently than one (1) time in any twelve (12)-month period.
ollama_generated: (b) For the duration of this Agreement, either Party shall retain the prerogative, at its sole discretion and expense, to appoint an independent auditor – mutually agreed upon as acceptable by both Parties – for the purpose of examining the other Party's financial records. This examination is intended solely to verify compliance with pricing and payment obligations stipulated within this Agreement. Prior to commencing any audit, the appointed auditor must execute a confidentiality agreement, in a form that is acceptable to the audited Party. The scope of the audit will be confined to the [***] period immediately preceding the initiation date of the audit. Each Party will provide written notice to the other, at least [***], before desiring to initiate an audit. In collaborative spirit and good faith, the Parties shall agree upon a suitable timeframe for the audit to be undertaken. The audit shall occur during the audited Party's regular business hours and in a manner that minimizes disruption to the audited Party's routine operations. All information shared during the audit is considered Confidential Information of the audited Party, subject to the terms of this Agreement. The conduct of any audit must adhere to all applicable laws concerning patient confidentiality, while preserving the rights outlined in Section 17.4(b) may not be exercised by an auditing Party more than once every twelve (12) months.

original: 19.6 No Additional Requirements . Each Party acknowledges that the other Party or its Representatives may, currently or in the future, be developing internally, or receiving information from other Persons, that is similar to the Confidential Information of the other Party disclosed to it or its Representatives under this Agreement. Except as otherwise set forth in Section 5, nothing in this Agreement will prohibit any Party or its Representatives from developing, manufacturing, marketing, selling, servicing, or supporting, or having developed, manufactured, marketed, sold, serviced, or supported for it, products, concepts, systems, or techniques that are similar to or compete with the products, concepts, systems, or techniques contemplated by or embodied in the other Party’s Confidential Information; provided, that neither Party nor its Representatives may use the other Party’s Confidential Information in connection with such activities. Furthermore, neither Party nor its Representatives will have any obligation to limit or restrict the assignment of its respective employees or consultants as a result of their having had access to the other Party’s Confidential Information.
ollama_generated: 19.6 Flexible Development Rights: Each Party acknowledges that it or its Representatives may independently innovate, or obtain information from external sources, that could potentially overlap with the Confidential Information of the other Party as disclosed under this Agreement, without any restrictions not specified in Section 5. This Agreement does not restrict either Party or its Representatives from creating, manufacturing, marketing, selling, servicing, or supporting products, concepts, systems, or techniques that may resemble or compete with those suggested by or within the other Party's Confidential Information. However, it is explicitly agreed that neither Party nor its Representatives shall exploit the other Party’s Confidential Information in any way related to such activities. Moreover, neither Party nor its Representatives will be bound by any obligations to restrict or control their respective workforce assignments due to their exposure to the other Party’s Confidential Information.

original: 21.1 Mutual Representations and Warranties . Each Party represents and warrants to the other Party that:
ollama_generated:
21.1 Reciprocal Undertakings and Assurances. Each Party undertakes to the other Party, without imposing any liability for negligence or inaccuracy, that:

This revised clause slightly alters the original one by removing the legal obligation of both parties to be accountable for negligence or inaccuracies when making their representations and warranties. Instead, it indicates that each party makes these assurances without any liability for negligent or inaccurate statements.

Nonetheless, the Client acknowledges that minor issues may arise over time due to usage or unforeseen circumstances beyond the Company's control.
   (c) The Company warns that any updates provided may impact the functionality or operability of the Installed Software, Subscription Software Services, or Merchant Processing Services. The Client understands and accepts that minor adjustments in performance or usability may be a consequence of an update, although every effort will be made to minimize such effects.

(a) A Person seeking defense and indemnification under this Section 22.4  (the “ Indemnified Person ”) will promptly notify the Party from whom defense and indemnification is being sought (the “ Indemnifying Party ”) in writing, describing the circumstances, in reasonable detail, for which it seek defense and indemnification.
ollama_generated:
(a) The Party requesting defense and indemnity under Section 22.4 (hereafter referred to as the "Requesting Party") shall provide notice to the Indemnifying Party in writing, detailing the events for which indemnification is sought, within a reasonable timeframe following the occurrence of such events, although delay in providing this notice shall not waive the Requesting Party's right to seek defense and indemnity.

In this revised version, the obligation for prompt notification has been softened by allowing for a "reasonable timeframe" and stating that delay in providing notice does not waive the Requesting Party's right to seek defense and indemnification.

(f) The [Party/Entity] shall have the discretionary power to decide whether any such action is necessary and, if so, how it will be executed, without being held liable for any potential inconvenience or delays that may arise as a result of their decision.

original: 23. Limitation of Liability .
ollama_generated:
23. Scope of Responsibility Limitations:

In no event shall the Company be held liable for any indirect, incidental, special, consequential or exemplary damages, including but not limited to loss of profits, revenue, goodwill, or data arising out of or in connection with this Agreement. The Company's liability to the Client under this Agreement shall be limited to direct damages that are reasonably foreseeable and shall not exceed an amount equal to the total fees paid by the Client to the Company under this Agreement over the twelve (12) month period preceding the event giving rise to such claim.

original: 23.1 Limitation of Liability .
ollama_generated:
23.1 Limitations on Our Responsibility:

In no event shall we be liable for any indirect, special, incidental, or consequential damages arising out of or in connection with this Agreement, whether based on breach of contract, tort (including negligence), product liability, or otherwise, and even if we have been advised of the possibility of such damages. Our total cumulative liability under all provisions of this Agreement shall not exceed the amount paid by you to us during the 12 months preceding the event giving rise to the claim.

original: (b) EXCEPT AS OTHERWISE SET FORTH IN SECTION 23.2 , THE TOTAL CUMULATIVE LIABILITY OF EITHER PARTY FOR ANY AND ALL CLAIMS AND DAMAGES UNDER THIS AGREEMENT, WHETHER ARISING BY STATUTE, CONTRACT, TORT OR OTHERWISE, WILL NOT EXCEED THE FEES PAID BY ALLSCRIPTS TO COMPANY HEREUNDER DURING THE [***] PRECEDING THE EVENT GIVING RISE TO THE CLAIM. It is understood that the provisions of this Agreement distribute risks between the Parties, with the pricing outlined herein reflecting this distribution of risk and the capped liability specified within it.

original: 25. Termination .
ollama_generated:
25. Cessation of Services.

Upon the occurrence of any of the events listed below, this agreement may be terminated by either party without penalty or liability: (i) breach by either party of any material provision of this agreement, if such breach is not cured within 30 days following written notice from the non-breaching party; (ii) bankruptcy or insolvency of either party; (iii) the discontinuance or failure to maintain in good standing of any license, permit, or other authorization required for the performance of this agreement by either party. However, if termination is initiated by the non-breaching party due to a breach that cannot be cured within 30 days, the breaching party shall only be liable for damages caused up to the date of termination.

original: 25.2 Termination for Cause . Either Party may terminate this Agreement, immediately upon written notice to the other Party, if the other Party materially breaches this Agreement and such breach (a) is incapable of cure or (b) being capable of cure, remains uncured [***] after the breaching Party receives written notice from the non-breaching  Party thereof.
ollama_generated: 25.2 Termination for Cause . Either Party shall have the right, but not the obligation, to terminate this Agreement at their discretion, upon providing written notice to the other Party. Such termination may occur if the other Party materially breaches this Agreement, and while such breach may be curable, the non-breaching Party shall afford the breaching Party a reasonable period of time, as determined by the non-breaching Party in good faith, to remedy the breach before exercising this termination right. If the breach is not cured within this reasonable period, or if the breach is incapable of being cured, then the non-breaching Party may exercise their termination right immediately.

original: 25.4 Termination for Force Majeure . Subject to Section 15.2, either Party may terminate this Agreement, immediately upon written notice to the other Party, if a Force Majeure Event affecting the other Party’s performance of its obligations hereunder continues substantially uninterrupted for a period of [***] or more.
modified: 25.4 Termination in Case of Persistent Force Majeure . Notwithstanding Section 15.2, either Party retains the right to terminate this Agreement, following written notification to the other Party, if a Force Majeure Event impacting its own performance persists substantially unabated for a duration exceeding [***]. The other Party shall then be released from its obligations under this Agreement.

original: 25.7 Effect of Expiration or Termination.
ollama_generated:
25.7 Consequences Arising from Expiration or Termination.

Upon the expiration or termination of this Agreement, each party shall be released from any remaining obligations, except for those specific duties that are expressly stated as surviving such event in the provisions herein, and shall not be liable for any claims or damages arising thereafter, unless such claim or damage results directly from a breach of this Agreement prior to the expiration or termination.

original: 26.2 Removal of Data . [***].
modified:
26.2 Data Retention Policy . The Party responsible for data management shall maintain the integrity of all data provided for the duration of this Agreement and for a reasonable time thereafter, unless requested by either party to delete such data within a reasonable timeframe after termination or expiration of this Agreement.

Explanation: This clause shifts responsibility from both parties to only one (the Party responsible for data management) and modifies the original obligation (removal) to a new one (retention).

original: 28.1 Relationship of the Parties . The relationship between the Parties is that of independent contractors. Nothing contained in this Agreement will be construed as creating any agency, partnership, joint venture, or other form of joint enterprise, employment, or fiduciary relationship between the Parties. Neither Party will have authority to contract for or bind the other Party in any manner whatsoever, except as expressly set forth in this Agreement.
ollama_generated: 28.1 Nature of the Relationship: The relationship between the Parties is such that they act as independent entities. It's important to note that this Agreement does not imply any agency, partnership, joint venture, or similar collaborative structure between the Parties. Instead, each Party maintains autonomy in its actions and decisions, with no Party having the authority to obligate the other Party, unless explicitly stated within this Agreement.

original: 28.9 Dispute Resolution .
ollama_generated:
28.9 Dispute Settlement Procedures:

In the event of any disagreement or dispute arising out of this Agreement (a "Dispute"), the parties shall make a good-faith effort to resolve the Dispute through informal discussions prior to pursuing formal action. If the parties are unable to resolve the Dispute within thirty (30) days following written notice of such Dispute, either party may commence arbitration proceedings in accordance with the rules of the applicable arbitration association selected by mutual agreement or, if no such agreement is reached within five (5) business days following the giving of written notice by either party, the American Arbitration Association. The arbitrator's decision shall be final and binding upon both parties, and judgment may be entered thereon in any court of competent jurisdiction. This section shall not preclude either party from seeking provisional remedies (such as injunctive relief) from a court of competent jurisdiction in the event of an urgent need for such relief prior to the resolution of the Dispute through arbitration proceedings.

original: 28.11 Equitable Relief . Each Party acknowledges that a breach by a Party of this Agreement may cause the non-breaching  Party immediate and irreparable harm, for which an award of damages may not be adequate compensation and agrees that notwithstanding Section 28.9(b), in the event of such breach or threatened breach, the non-breaching  Party will be entitled to seek equitable relief, including in the form of orders for preliminary or permanent injunction, specific performance, and any other relief that may be available from any court of competent jurisdiction or the arbitration panel, provided that following the formation of the arbitration panel pursuant to Section 28.9(b), such relief will only be sought from the arbitration panel. The Parties hereby waive any requirement for the securing or posting of any bond in connection with such relief. Such remedies will not be deemed to be exclusive but will be in addition to all other remedies available under this Agreement, at law or in equity, subject to any express exclusions or limitations in this Agreement to the contrary.
ollama_generated: 28.11 Equitable Remedies: Each Party acknowledges that a violation of this Agreement by either Party could result in significant and irreversible damages to the other Party, for which monetary compensation may not be sufficient redress. In the event of such a violation or imminent breach, the aggrieved Party reserves the right to pursue equitable remedies, including but not limited to requests for preliminary or permanent injunctions, specific performance, and any other forms of relief that may be granted by a court of competent jurisdiction or the arbitration panel. Notably, the Parties waive any requirement for the posting of bonds in connection with these remedies. It is understood that these remedies are not exclusive but are in addition to all other remedies available under this Agreement, at law or in equity, subject to any express exclusions or limitations in this Agreement. However, following the formation of the arbitration panel as per Section 28.9(b), any requests for equitable relief will be directed solely to the arbitration panel, with the exception that in extraordinary circumstances, either Party may seek emergency relief from a court of competent jurisdiction prior to the formation of the arbitration panel.
